result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence D. Brock Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (10 Days +), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond on file to be applied.

Serve 70 days in Marquette County Jail w/huber
Sentence to commene forthwith
***May serve in Dane County if approved***
35 Days Credit
(Defendant advised by Court he was convicted of felony and advised re: rights of voting and of owning a firearm.)

records.addlTxt: reminder notice for unpaid fines/fees
Defendant's copy of Notice of Hearing - Return on Warrant -  returned undeliverable - Unable to Forward per USPS
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Lawrence D. Brock in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Lawrence D. Brock in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz makes statement on defendant's non-apearance last week.  Atty Hendee makes statement.  BY THE COURT:  Based on the defendant's appearance here today, Court will quash the warrant.
Atty Hendee requests an additional $1,000 cash bond.  Recess.  Case recalled at 3:28pm.  Atty Gumz states there is now a resolution.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Requests previous bonds be reinstated and defendant will enter a plea to the charge. Atty Gumz agrees.  Neither party is requesting a PSI.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant enters No Contest plea to the charge.   Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.    Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  
Counsel make sentencing arguments.  Defendant makes statement to the Court.  Court will reinstate the previous cash bonds.  
BY THE COURT:  Court sentences defendant to serve 70 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber.  *Sentence to commence forthwith.  *May be served in Dane County if approved.  *Pay costs of $268.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges of $250.00.  *Granted 35 days credit.  *Bond on file to be applied.  
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Return on warrant on July 28, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Signed by BNB/07-22-16 for FTA

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  Defendant has two active warrants out of Dane County as well.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
cash bond to be forfieted.
Defendant's copy of Notice of Plea/Sentencing Hearing returned undeliverable - Unable to Forward per USPS
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  
Atty Gumz states that he could not get in contact with this client this morning.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; stayed for 48 hours.
Bond will be forfieted.

Final pre-trial at 05-27-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 07-14-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence D. Brock in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.   Attorney Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
appeared in Court
Preliminary hearing at 02-17-2016 10:00 am
*$250.00 previously posted.  Defendant to post an additional $250.00 to be released.

Defendant Lawrence D. Brock in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Lawrence D. Brock in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant canceled as defendant is in custody.  
Court questions defendant on his failure to appear.  Defendant makes statement.  
Atty Hendee requests an additional $2500 cash.  Atty Gumz requests some consideration after listening to defendants circumstances and transportation is an issue.
BY THE COURT:  Court orders an additional 250.00 cash.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lawrence D. Brock Sr.

Prior: 609 N. 4th Ave, Wausau, WI 54401

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz requests 1 day to contact his client before a warrant is issued.  States his client does not have a ride.  Atty Hendee requests warrant on defendant's failure to appear.  
BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.  Stayed until tomorrow to see if defendant can get here then.
Preliminary hearing at 05-06-2015 10:00 am

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Tania Marie Bonnett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he spoke with his client yesterday and the defendant does not have a valid DL so he could not get a ride here today.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset.  Atty Bonnett asks for a warrant based on the defendant's non appearance.

BY THE COURT:  Reset one last time.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Court questions regarding time limits.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Set Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Lawrence D. Brock in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz appearing by telephone.  Defendant Lawrence D. Brock in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that a summons was sent with a warrant.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant did call regarding his sentence and will be doing some investigation.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond; no conditions requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
